# ggdodge

<!-- badges: start -->
[![Lifecycle: experimental](https://img.shields.io/badge/lifecycle-experimental-orange.svg)](https://lifecycle.r-lib.org/articles/stages.html#experimental)
[![CRAN status](https://www.r-pkg.org/badges/version/ggdodge)](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=ggdodge)
<!-- badges: end -->

The goal of ggdodge is to take single axes fed to geom_point and provide the other axis such that the points don't overlap

## Installation

You can install the development version of ggdodge like so:

``` r
remotes::install_github('selkamand/ggdodge')
```
